Description: Knob-shaped object made of fine brown Nile clay. The base is round and very flat, it was pressed onto a flat surface to form it. The upper side shows a central area that is raised with concave sides running upwards from the base and forms a cylindrical part with a shallow indentation in the middle to attach another object. The depth of this indentation is 0.9 cm, it has a diameter of 1.4 cm and the wall around it is 0.5 cm wide with an outer diameter of 2.2-2.3 cm for the central raised part. The base is partly chipped off, partly was it not formed perfectly round. Some sort of stand or knob. Some white accretion on the surface.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 148?)
